intro: Nothopanax integrifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves with smooth, entire margins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by spherical, red berries. Nothopanax integrifolius is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture.
